result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E O'Brien

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM Called 22CF186 for STC.  Defendant James E O'Brien in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for James E O'Brien.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. All in person.  Attny Erdman updates the court, not resolved, asking for a trial date.  State confirms 1 day trial.  Attny Erdman requests speedy jury trial, def confirms okay with close to that is okay, just to keep things moving.  FPT & JT set.  State recites offer, Plead to counts 2 & 3, 1 year probation, imposed and state jail sentence, 3 months each so 6 months jail stayed and imposed total, no contact with victims.  Def to discuss with Attny, may counter offer. FPT is drop dead date for a resolution.  Bond continues.
Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:52 AM Defendant James E O'Brien in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for James E O'Brien.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Detective Patrick Carlson, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Erdman crosses.  State objects- beyond the scope; sustained.  No redirect.  State asks for a bind-over.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information mirroring complaint.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Discussion of speedy trial, waiting to receive discovery before demanding speedy.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E O'Brien in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for James E O'Brien. Case was set for prelim, but def wants meeting with attorney prior. Court resets the prelim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E O'Brien in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for James E O'Brien.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Requests prelim within time limits.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant

Defendant shall not use or possess any firearms or other weapons.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with any victims or their residences.  Defendant is subject to a curfew, and must be at his residence between 8 pm - 8 am.
